course.subject: CIVL
course.name: Water, Energy and Climate Challenges in Smart Cities
course.description: This course is a mixture of lecture, readings, and student project focused on environmental challenges in smart cities, particularly the ones related to energy, water and climate. Mathematical and physical laws and concepts that are fundamental to urban science will be introduced. Lectures will cover grand challenges associated with urban development in the 21st century and their potential engineering solutions. The students will then perform a final research project on a topic of their interest, related to smart cities, with the aim of understanding the current trend of science and technology.

reviews.author: TTzzz
reviews.comment_content: This course covers some hot topics in urban, like the urban heat island effect. We learn some Matlab code by doing the projects.
reviews.comment_teaching: Not boring. Prof conducted some tutorials to teach us about MATLAB.
reviews.comment_grading: Seems around 20 students enrolled in this course? Most of students got A to B. Seems no one fails.
reviews.comment_workload: Totally there are about 3 Homework assignments (I forgot////sorry) Some calculation questions in each homework assignment. Each student needs to finish a project with 3 classmates and present it in class. A report based on the project is required.
